packs.title: Bleeding Control
packs.oneLiner: Stop heavy bleeding fast until help arrives.

steps.title: Direct pressure
steps.body: Cover with clean cloth and press firmly.

steps.title: Elevate limb
steps.body: Keep above heart if possible.

steps.title: Do not remove soaked pads
steps.body: Add new layers on top; keep pressure.

steps.title: Watch for shock
steps.body: Pale skin, fast pulse, confusion. Keep warm.

steps.title: Check responsiveness
steps.body: Tap shoulders firmly, shout 'Are you okay?' loudly. Look for any response, movement, or normal breathing. If unresponsive, proceed immediately.

steps.title: Call 911
steps.body: Get help immediately before starting CPR. If others present, point to specific person and say 'You call 911'. Request AED if available nearby.

steps.title: Position hands
steps.body: Heel of one hand on center of chest between nipples, interlock fingers of other hand. Keep arms straight, shoulders directly over hands.

steps.title: 30 compressions
steps.body: Push hard and fast at least 2 inches deep, 100-120 per minute. Let chest return completely between compressions. Count out loud.

steps.title: 2 rescue breaths
steps.body: Tilt head back, lift chin, pinch nose closed. Seal mouth with your mouth and give 2 breaths, each lasting 1 second. Watch for chest rise.

steps.title: Continue cycles
steps.body: Repeat 30 compressions and 2 breaths continuously. Don't stop until emergency services arrive or person starts breathing normally. Switch rescuers every 2 minutes if possible.

steps.title: Move to warm shelter
steps.body: Remove from cold environment. Handle gently to avoid cardiac arrythmia.

steps.title: Remove wet clothing
steps.body: Cut off if necessary. Replace with dry, loose layers.

steps.title: Warm core first
steps.body: Heat packs to chest, neck, armpits. Avoid extremities first.

steps.title: Monitor breathing
steps.body: Check pulse for full 60 seconds. Be prepared for CPR if needed.

packs.title: Wind Shelter Basics
packs.oneLiner: A-frame tarp shelter when wind rips your tent.

steps.title: Find leeward
steps.body: Behind rock, trees, or slope.

steps.title: A-frame
steps.body: Tripod frame; ridge line taut.

steps.title: Tarp on leeward
steps.body: Stake low; close windward side.

steps.title: Weight edges
steps.body: Rocks/packs every 50 cm for stability.

steps.title: Assess water source
steps.body: Clear running water best. Avoid stagnant or animal-contaminated sources.

steps.title: Pre-filter if cloudy
steps.body: Cloth or sand/gravel layers to remove debris.

steps.title: Boiling method
steps.body: Rolling boil for 1 minute (3 minutes above 6,500ft altitude).

steps.title: Chemical backup
steps.body: Purification tablets or 2 drops bleach per liter. Wait 30 minutes.

packs.title: Wildlife: Snakebite
packs.oneLiner: Immobilize and monitor swelling; no cutting.

steps.title: Immobilize limb
steps.body: Keep below heart; minimize movement.

steps.title: Remove rings/watches
steps.body: Swelling may trap jewelry.

steps.title: No cutting or suction
steps.body: Do not apply tourniquet or ice.

steps.title: Observe symptoms
steps.body: Pain, swelling, breathing issues.

steps.title: Secure car
steps.body: Hazards, handbrake, wheel chock. Make sure the car is on flat, solid ground away from traffic. Set parking brake and turn on hazard lights for visibility.

steps.title: Loosen lugs
steps.body: Quarter turn while on ground. Use the wrench in a counter-clockwise direction to break the initial resistance while tire still has traction.

steps.title: Jack & swap
steps.body: Jack at reinforced point; replace wheel. Locate the proper jacking point in your owner's manual. Raise the car until the flat tire is completely off the ground.

steps.title: Tighten cross pattern
steps.body: Lower car; torque diagonally. Hand-tighten in a star pattern, lower the jack, then fully tighten with the wrench using the same pattern.

steps.title: Assess chain damage
steps.body: Check if chain is derailed, broken, or just loose.

steps.title: If derailed
steps.body: Lift rear wheel, pedal slowly while guiding chain back onto gears.

steps.title: If broken link
steps.body: Use chain tool or quick link to remove damaged section and reconnect.

steps.title: Test chain tension
steps.body: Should have 1/2 inch play. Adjust rear derailleur if needed.

packs.title: Quick Phrases PL↔ES
packs.oneLiner: Show or play key phrases instantly.

steps.title: I need help
steps.body: "Necesito ayuda, por favor."

steps.title: I have a headache
steps.body: "Me duele la cabeza."

steps.title: Where is drinking water?
steps.body: "¿Dónde hay agua potable?"

steps.title: Find visible landmark
steps.body: Look for tall buildings, bridges, or monuments you can describe.

steps.title: Ask for main street
steps.body: "Where is [main street name]?" Point to help with language barriers.

steps.title: Locate transit hub
steps.body: Bus station, train station, or subway entrance usually has maps.

steps.title: Note return path
steps.body: Remember key turns and landmarks for getting back.
